item.title: 埃隆-马斯克的 X 公司因未删除未经同意的亲密图片而面临加拿大罚款
item.description: 上周公布的一项裁决显示，加拿大民事法庭对埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的社交媒体平台 X 处以罚款，原因是该公司拒绝执行删除一张未经同意的亲密图片的命令。【原文：A Canadian civil tribunal has fined Elon Musk’s social media platform X for its refusal to comply with an order to remove a non-consensual intimate image, a decision published last week showed.】

item.title: 英伟达发布用于视频和软件生成的人工智能芯片
item.description: 英伟达（Nvidia）周二表示，将在明年年底前推出一款新的人工智能芯片，旨在处理创建视频和软件等复杂功能。【原文：Nvidia said on Tuesday it would launch a new artificial intelligence chip by the end of next year, designed to handle complex functions such as creating videos and software.】

item.title: 微软规定明年起三天不办公
item.description: 微软公司周二在一篇博客文章中说，从明年开始，微软将要求员工每周至少有三天在办公室工作。【原文：Microsoft will require employees to work from office at least three days a week starting next year, the company said in a blog post on Tuesday.】

item.title: ITB 汽车公司将接管闲置的意大利工厂，生产中国微型车
item.description: 意大利工业部周二表示，ITB 汽车公司将接管意大利北部一家闲置的汽车零部件工厂，投资约 1 亿欧元（1.173 亿美元）生产中国电动微型车。【原文：ITB Auto is set to take over an idled auto components factory in northern Italy to produce Chinese electric minicars with an investment of about 100 million euros ($117.3 million), the industry ministry said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 受美国降息希望和美联储紧张局势影响，黄金涨至新纪录
item.description: 周二，受美国降息预期、对美联储独立性的担忧以及投资者和中央银行强劲需求的刺激，黄金创下了每盎司 3,600 美元以上的历史新高。【原文：Gold hit a record high above $3,600 an ounce on Tuesday, spurred by expectations of U.S. rate cuts, concerns about Federal Reserve independence and robust demand from investors and central banks.】

item.title: 法官批准 Vanguard 就共同基金税单达成的修订和解协议
item.description: 联邦法官批准了先锋集团（Vanguard Group）2500 万美元的和解协议，该诉讼指控美国共同基金公司不当向其目标日期基金的投资者收取高额税费。【原文：A federal judge approved Vanguard Group's $25 million settlement of a lawsuit accusing the U.S. mutual fund company of improperly saddling investors in its target-date funds with inflated tax bills.】

item.title: 荷兰调查 Snapchat，指控其未能解决 Vape 销售商问题
item.description: 荷兰消费者权益监督机构 ACM 周二表示，它已对社交媒体平台 Snapchat 展开调查，原因是该平台可能未能保护未成年人免受非法卖家的烟雾弹侵害。【原文：Dutch consumer rights watchdog ACM said on Tuesday it had opened an investigation into social media platform Snapchat, over possible failures to protect minors from illegal sellers of vapes.】

item.title: 应对美国关税，美容集团普伊格上半年利润增长 79
item.description: 以旗下香水品牌拉巴纳（Rabanne）、卡罗琳娜-海瑞拉（Carolina Herrera）和让-保罗-高缇耶（Jean Paul Gaultier）闻名的西班牙美容公司Puig周二表示，由于预期美国将提高关税，销售额增加，该公司上半年利润增长79%，达到2.75亿欧元（3.22亿美元）。【原文：Spanish beauty company Puig, known for its perfume brands Rabanne, Carolina Herrera and Jean Paul Gaultier, said on Tuesday its first-half profit rose 79% to 275 million euros ($322 million) as sales increased in anticipation of higher U.S. tariffs.】

item.title: 特朗普环保局寻求加快人工智能基础设施的审批速度
item.description: 环境保护局周二提出了新的措施，旨在加快人工智能数据中心快速建设所需的基础设施建设，使企业能够在获得空气许可之前就开始建设。【原文：The Environmental Protection Agency on Tuesday proposed new measures aimed at speeding construction of infrastructure needed for the rapid buildup of data centers for artificial intelligence that would enable companies to start building before obtaining air permits.】

item.title: 日产探索在南非推广混合动力汽车，以顺利转向电动汽车
item.description: 日本日产汽车公司的一位高管周二表示，该公司正在考虑在南非推出使用其 e-Power 技术的混合动力汽车，以帮助司机从汽油发动机转向电动汽车。【原文：Japan's Nissan Motor Co is considering a rollout of hybrid cars that use its e-Power technology in South Africa as a way to help drivers move from petrol engines towards electric vehicles, a company executive said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 摩根大通预计第三季度投资银行业务收入将实现低两位数增长
item.description: 摩根大通投资银行业务联席首席执行官道格-佩特诺（Doug Petno）表示，今年第三季度投资银行业务收入将实现低两位数增长。【原文：JPMorgan Chase Co-CEO of investment banking Doug Petno said that investment banking revenue will grow in low double digits for the third quarter of this year.】

item.title: 博世首席执行官预计2026年激烈竞争仍将持续
item.description: 全球最大的汽车零部件供应商博世（ROBG.UL）首席执行官周二表示，由于汽车行业正努力应对日益增长的贸易壁垒和价格下跌，博世预计明年该行业的竞争压力仍将持续。【原文：Bosch (ROBG.UL), the world's biggest auto parts supplier, expects competitive pressure in the sector to continue next year, its CEO said on Tuesday, as the industry grapples with growing trade barriers and price declines.】

item.title: 美联储被认为有望从下周开始在今年降息三次
item.description: 交易员们周二打赌，美联储可能会在下周恢复削减短期利率，并在今年余下的时间里继续下去，以支撑劳动力市场，而劳动力市场可能早在唐纳德-特朗普总统开始大幅提高关税之前就已经开始降温了。【原文：The Federal Reserve will likely resume cutting short-term rates next week and continue on for the rest of the year to shore up a labor market that may have begun cooling well before President Donald Trump began imposing sharply higher tariffs, traders bet on Tuesday.】

item.title: 摩根大通提升三位内部人士担任全球投资银行部主席，助力并购复兴
item.description: 摩根大通周二任命三位内部人士担任其投资银行部全球主席，美国银行将利用 2025 年交易活动的复苏为自己定位。【原文：JPMorgan Chase named three insiders as global chairs of its investment banking division on Tuesday, as U.S. banks position themselves to capitalize on a recovery in dealmaking activity in 2025.】

item.title: GASTECH 埃克森看好中国液化天然气需求，关注新市场
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司一位高级管理人员周二告诉路透社记者，该公司预计中国的液化天然气（LNG）需求将在运输和海运业的推动下强劲增长，并认为亚太地区、非洲和拉丁美洲的新市场机会不断增多。【原文：Exxon Mobil expects strong growth in demand for liquefied natural gas (LNG) in China, driven by transport and marine sectors, and sees rising opportunities in new markets across Asia Pacific, Africa and Latin America, a senior company executive told Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 波音公司加大喷气机交付力度，8 月总交付量超过 2024 架
item.description: 波音公司周二表示，8月份交付了57架喷气式飞机，高于7月份的48架。这是自2018年美国飞机制造商交付64架客机以来的最高交付量。【原文：Boeing said on Tuesday that it delivered 57 jets in August, up from 48 in July. It was the highest number of deliveries in August since 2018, when the U.S. planemaker handed over 64 airliners.】

item.title: 美国破产法院批准重组计划，Wolfspeed 公司股价大涨
item.description: 芯片制造商 Wolfspeed 的股价周二大涨约 48%，达到 1.82 美元，此前该公司称美国法院确认了其破产保护重组计划，为其在未来几周内退出破产保护扫清了道路。【原文：Chipmaker Wolfspeed's shares surged about 48% to $1.82 on Tuesday after it said a U.S. court confirmed its Chapter 11 reorganization plan, clearing the way to exit bankruptcy protection in the next several weeks.】

item.title: VIEW 美国 3 月份就业人数增长大幅下调
item.description: 美国政府周二表示，在截至3月份的12个月里，美国经济创造的就业岗位可能比此前估计的少91.1万个，这表明在唐纳德-特朗普总统对进口商品征收激进关税之前，就业增长就已经陷入停滞。【原文：The U.S. economy likely created 911,000 fewer jobs in the 12 months through March than previously estimated, the government said on Tuesday, suggesting job growth was already stalling before President Donald Trump's aggressive tariffs on imports.】

item.title: 美国司法部称，诺福克南方公司将给予美国铁路公司列车货运优先权
item.description: 美国司法部周二表示，诺福克南方公司（Norfolk Southern）已同意让美国铁路公司（Amtrak）的客运列车比货运列车享有 "最高优先权"。【原文：Norfolk Southern has agreed to give Amtrak passenger trains the "highest priority" over freight trains, the U.S. Justice Department said on Tuesday.】

item.title: Artemis 董事长皮诺表示，彪马股份不具战略意义，所有选择都将保留
item.description: 控制古驰（Gucci）所有者开云集团（Kering）的私人控股公司阿尔特米斯（Artemis）董事长弗朗索瓦-亨利-皮诺（Francois-Henri Pinault）周二表示，阿尔特米斯持有运动服装制造商彪马 29% 的股份 "不具有战略意义"。【原文：Francois-Henri Pinault, chairman of the privately-owned holding company Artemis that controls Gucci-owner Kering, said on Tuesday that Artemis' 29% stake in sportswear maker Puma was "not strategic."】

item.title: Kering 股东批准任命 Luca de Meo 为首席执行官
item.description: 古驰（Gucci）所有者开云集团（Kering）的股东们在周二举行的特别股东大会上批准了卢卡-德-梅奥（Luca de Meo）担任集团首席执行官的任命。【原文：Shareholders for Gucci owner Kering approved the appointment of Luca de Meo as the group's CEO at its extraordinary shareholder meeting on Tuesday.】

item.title: 欧盟批准 Doordash 收购 Deliveroo
item.description: 欧盟委员会周二表示，已批准美国送餐公司 DoorDash 收购 Deliveroo。【原文：The EU Commission on Tuesday said it had approved the takeover of Deliveroo by U.S. meal delivery firm DoorDash .】

item.title: 即时观点：以色列袭击卡塔尔后，石油飙升，黄金创下新纪录
item.description: 周二，以色列军方称对卡塔尔的哈马斯领导人发动了袭击，标志着该地区冲突升级，投资者抢购传统避险资产，黄金短暂创下历史新高。【原文：Investors snapped up traditional safe-haven assets on Tuesday, sending gold briefly to a new record high, after the Israeli military said it carried out an attack on Hamas leadership in Qatar, marking an escalation of the conflict in the region.】

item.title: 尽管航空供应链不断改善，空中客车公司首席执行官仍对发动机忧心忡忡
item.description: 空中客车公司首席执行官纪尧姆-福瑞（Guillaume Faury）周二表示，在这家欧洲飞机制造商努力增加喷气机交付量之际，发动机仍然是航空供应链中最具挑战性的部分。【原文：Airbus CEO Guillaume Faury said on Tuesday that engines remain the most challenging part of the aerospace supply chain, as the European planemaker seeks to grow jet deliveries.】

item.title: 美国 3 月份就业增长大幅下调
item.description: 美国政府周二表示，在截至3月份的12个月里，美国经济创造的就业岗位可能比此前估计的少91.1万个，这表明在唐纳德-特朗普总统对进口商品征收激进关税之前，就业增长已经陷入停滞。【原文：The U.S. economy likely created 911,000 fewer jobs in the 12 months through March than previously estimated, the government said on Tuesday, suggesting that job growth was already stalling before President Donald Trump's aggressive tariffs on imports.】

item.title: 对冲基金攀上八月高点，保持积极回报
item.description: 银行报告和熟悉对冲基金的消息来源显示，8 月份，随着股市（尤其是美国和亚洲股市）飙升至新高，以及医疗保健和科技行业股价的反弹，对冲基金的回报率受到了提振。【原文：Hedge fund returns were buoyed in August as stock markets raced to fresh highs, particularly in the United States and Asia, and shares in health care and technology industries rallied, bank reports and sources familiar with the funds suggest.】

item.title: 即将上任的 Kering 首席执行官 de Meo：修复集团需要 "清晰有力 "的决策
item.description: 即将上任的开云集团首席执行官卢卡-德-梅奥（Luca de Meo）周二在股东大会上表示，他将带领这家陷入困境的奢侈品集团重回正轨，其中包括做出 "明确而有力 "的决定，但这并不容易。【原文：Incoming Kering chief executive Luca de Meo told a shareholder meeting on Tuesday he would bring the struggling luxury group back on track, which will include taking "clear and strong" decisions that won't be easy.】

item.title: Klarna 将为期待已久的美国 IPO 定价，推动金融科技公司上市
item.description: 瑞典 "现购现付 "贷款公司 Klarna 将于本周二晚些时候为其期待已久的美国首次公开募股定价，这将为该公司的首次公开募股奠定基础，它将成为高增长金融科技公司上市的风向标，受到市场的密切关注。【原文：Swedish buy-now, pay-later lender Klarna is set to price its long-awaited U.S. IPO later on Tuesday, setting the stage for a market debut closely watched as a bellwether for high-growth fintech listings.】

item.title: 富国银行称美国消费者财务状况强劲，信用良好
item.description: 富国银行（Wells Fargo）首席财务官迈克-桑托马西莫（Mike Santomassimo）周二表示，美国消费者正在增加支出并按时支付账单，这反映出他们的财务状况持续健康。【原文：U.S. consumers are raising spending and paying bills on time, reflecting their continued financial health, said Wells Fargo Chief Financial Officer Mike Santomassimo on Tuesday.】

item.title: 蒙特卡洛银行如何从濒临倒闭到收购 Mediobanca
item.description: Monte dei Paschi di Siena（MPS）以 160 亿欧元（约合 190 亿美元）的股份加现金收购价获得了对 Mediobanca 的控制权。【原文：Monte dei Paschi di Siena (MPS) has secured control of Mediobanca , with a 16 billion euro ($19 billion) share-and-cash offer.】
